name: Airport '94
overview: Though listed as a flight simulator, this game is possibly more valuable teaching number touch typing as all commands are given by typing the flight number listed on the plane and the command or runway number you want it to land on. You can give landing commands, put planes in holding patterns, down and turn, up and turn and raise and lower planes in the flight pattern and so forth. This game by David M. Moorman was first released in Loadstar #118.
